column4: how do you delete a file using the terminal. what command do you use?
example i want to delete the file that i accidentaly saved inside the folder 'apt' the filename is ubuntu list. I was editing the sources.list
you need sudo rm if the file is outside your $HOME directory
is it like this $ sudo rm /etc/apt/ubuntulist.txt
assuming that is the path to the file, yes
the filename contains a white space "Ubuntu sources.list" should I type it that way?
be careful that you are actually deleting the file you mean to delete!
whew. thanks. I got it deleted
heh - I doubt that it was doing any harm actually ( it would be ignored - doesn't mean anything to the system)
i guess you still learnt a couple of tricks in the process :)
in fact yes.... I was just starting to learn ubuntu. Is there a tutorial where i can learn the basic and advance commands they use in the terminal?
and its the Linux Operating System that i've used
